v.v: This is King Solomon’s most beautiful song.
I wish he would kiss me on my lips,
The fragrance of the perfume on your skin is very sweet.
Take me quickly;
You women of Jerusalem,
But do not stare at me because the sun has made my skin dark.
You whom I love, where will you take your flock of sheep today?
You who are the most beautiful of all the women,
You are beautiful, my darling, like one of the young female horses
Your earrings are decorations for your cheeks,
I will make for you some gold earrings
While the king was on his couch,
The man who loves me stays between my breasts during the night like a bag of perfume tied around my neck.
He is like a bunch of flowers from the vineyards at En Gedi.
You whom I love, you are beautiful;
You who love me, you are very delightful,
Branches of cedar trees will shade us;
I am like an insignificant flower in the plains,
Among all the other young women,
Among all the other men, this man is the one who loves me; he is like a tree that grows in the forest.
He led me to the room where I feasted on his love,
Refresh me and strengthen me with your lovemaking.
I hope he puts his left arm under my head
You young women of Jerusalem,
I hear the voice of the man who loves me.
like a deer or a gazelle.
He spoke to me and said,
Look, the winter has ended;
The flowers are blooming throughout the country.
There are young figs on the fig trees,
You are like a dove hiding in the rocky cliff.
There are other men who ruin women as wild dogs ruin vineyards;
This man whom I love—I belong to him, and he belongs to me.
You whom I love, you must go away before dawn, when the darkness disappears.
During the entire night while I lay on my bed,
So I said to myself,
The city watchmen saw me
As soon as I walked past them,
You women of Jerusalem,
What is that I see coming from the wilderness,
It is Solomon’s litter carried by servants and
They all have swords
King Solomon commanded his servants to make that litter for him;
The canopy that covered it was held up by silver posts,
You women of Jerusalem,
My darling, you are beautiful,
Your teeth are very white,
Your lips are like a scarlet ribbon,
Your long neck is beautiful, like the tower of King David
Your breasts are as delicate as two young twin deer
Until dawn tomorrow morning,
My darling, you are completely beautiful;
My darling, it is as though you were in Lebanon
You who are most dear to me, when I see you,
My bride, your love for me is delightful!
When you kiss me, it is better than when I eat honey.
You who are most dear to me, you are like a garden that the owner keeps locked
You are like an orchard of pomegranate trees
saffron and calamus and cinnamon
You are like a fountain in a garden,
I want the north wind and the south wind to come,
You who are most dear to me,
I was asleep, and I had a dream.
But I had already taken off my robe;
The one who loves me put his hand through the opening in the door,
I got up to open the door for him,
I opened the door for the man who loves me,
The city watchmen saw me while they were walking around the city.
You young women of Jerusalem,
You who are the fairest among women,
It is because the man who loves me is handsome and healthy,
His head is beautiful, like purest gold;
His eyes as gentle as doves
His cheeks are like a garden full of spice trees
His arms are like gold rods that have rounded ends,
His legs are like marble columns
His kisses are very sweet;
You who are the most beautiful of the women,
The one who loves me has come to me, I, who am like his garden,
I belong to the one who loves me, and the one who loves me belongs to me.
My darling, you are beautiful,
Stop looking at me like that,
Your teeth are very white
Beneath your veil,
Even if a king had 60 queens and 80 concubines
none of them would be like my dove, who is perfect,
Who is this who looks like the dawn,
I went down to some walnut trees
I was as happy as if
You who are the perfect one,
You, the daughter of a prince,
Your navel is like a round bowl
Your breasts are as delicate as two young twin deer.
Your neck is like a tower made of ivory.
Your head is majestic like Mount Carmel.
My love, you are so beautiful and lovely
You are stately like a palm tree,
I said to myself, “I will climb that palm tree
I want your kisses to be like very good wine.
I belong to the man who loves me,
You who love me, let us go to the countryside,
And let us go early to the vineyards
The mandrake plants are producing a fragrant odor,
I wish that everyone knew that we love each other, just as they all know that I have a brother,
No one would object if I led you to our mother’s house,
Oh yes! He will put his left arm under my head,
I want you to promise me, you women of Jerusalem,
Who is that woman who is coming up from the wilderness,
Keep me close to you,
Nothing can stop us from loving each other,
We have a younger sister,
If her chest is as flat as a wall,
My chest was previously flat like a wall,
King Solomon had a vineyard at Baal Hamon,
But my body is like my own vineyard,
You are staying in the gardens,
You who love me, come to me quickly;

v: because your love for me is more delightful than wine.
And your honor is very great and is spreading,
like the fragrance of the special oil that you have put on your skin.
That is why the other young women are attracted to you.
take me to your home.
He is like a king to me;
he has brought me into his bedroom.
I am very happy about you;
my love for you is better than wine.
It is not surprising that the other young women adore you.
I am dark but beautiful;
my dark skin is like the tents in Kedar,
or like the beautiful curtains in Solomon’s palace.
my brothers were angry with me,
so they forced me to work out in the sunshine in the vineyards,
so I was not able to take good care of my body.
Where will you allow them to rest at noontime?
I want to know because it is not right for me to wander around like a prostitute
looking for you among the flocks that belong to your friends.
if you search for me and do not know where I will take my sheep,
follow the tracks of the sheep.
Then allow your young goats to graze near the shepherds’ tents.
that pull the chariots belonging to the king of Egypt.
and there are strings of beads around your neck.
that are decorated with silver.
the smell of my perfume spread around the room.
you are very beautiful!
Your eyes are as delightful as doves.
you are wonderful!
This green grass in the countryside will be like a couch where we can lie down.
the fir branches overhead are like a roof for us.
